== Problem ==
----
Access elements in the HTML document


== Solution ==
--------------

An element can be accessed by its attribute `id` with the Python dictionary syntax `doc[elt_id]`

{{{
<html>
<head>
<script src="brython.js"></script>
</head>
<body>

<div id="zone">this is a DIV element</div>

<script type="text/python">
elt = doc["zone"]
</script>
</body>
</html>
}}}

To get all the tags of the same name in the document, use the syntax `doc[`_`TAG`_`]` where _`TAG`_ is the function defined in the module `html` for this tag. For instance, to get all the anchors (tag `A`) :

{{{
<script type="text/python">
import html
elts = doc[html.A]
</script>
}}}


Elements such as DIV have attributes `text` and `html` representing its inner text and inner HTML code. These attributes can be set as shown in the code above to change the element inner text
